Hello all,

Since last week we're testing Heritrix on an outsourced server=
. There
are no problems when we're writing the job-data to the local disk o=
f
that server. But when a symbolic link is made from '$HERITRIX_HOME/jobs'
=
to an NFS-mount, the java-proces (the JVM I presume) gets 'defunct', and
ca=
nnot be killed, not even with 'kill -9 PID' or a 'killall -9 PID'.
This hap=
pens when a new job is being created through Heritrix' web-ui.
After this, =
Heritrix does not respond anymore and the server has to be
rebooted. This i=
s how the proces looks like:

$ ps aux
USER       PID %CPU %MEM   VSZ  RSS =
TTY      STAT START   TIME COMMAND
...
bart      7911  2.0  0.0     0    0 =
?        Zl   09:50   0:03 [java]
<defunct>
...

We're using:

 * Heritrix =
1.10.1
 * Sun's JRE 1.5.0 update 10
 * Linux Red Hat AS 4


On the followin=
g page I found something about problems while writing to
an NFS mount:
http=
://crawler.archive.org/articles/releasenotes.html#1_10_0_limitations

-----=
-----------------------------------------------------
1.2.1. java.io.IOExce=
ption: No locks available
BDB-JE will complain 'No locks available' when cr=
awler is 
being built/run on an NFS mount. Workaround is to locate 
the 'st=
ate' directory on a non-NFS-mounted volume.
-------------------------------=
---------------------------

Might this be the problem: where can I find th=
is excepion? I could not
find it in "$HERITRIX_HOME/heritrix_out.log". Neit=
her is it thrown and
displayed in Heritrix' web-ui. Also, it doesn't mentio=
n anything about a
defunct proces, so I'm not sure if this is the problem a=
t hand. And it
says "being built/run on an NFS mount", where in our case, H=
eritrix
merely writes the job-data to the NFS-mount.

Has any of you encoun=
tered this before?

Kind regards,

Bart Kiers.
